name: places/ChIJXdq73B_0wokRMoNhkUydiUQ
formattedAddress: 619 W 179th St A, New York, NY 10033, USA
adrFormatAddress: 619 W 179th St A, New York, NY 10033-5763, USA

originalText.text: Not a good place, yes they provide the community with free food during these hard times. However, they keep most of the food for those who attend their service on Sunday's. I see them from my apartment, they do not give the majority of the food to those who stand in line for more then an hour. Then they take most of the food inside their "church" and give it to the ones who attend "mass." I have heard people asking for food and they tell them no, and not in a nice way. It's not right for them to hand pick what food they will give to the community and leave the majority to those who go on Sunday. During this pandemic, they should not be cheating people out of food. Shame on them!!!! And YES, during the summer they bring out two big speakers and have mass outside for 3 to 4 hours.

originalText.text:
DO NOT TRUST THIS PLACE. Shady at best. Untrustworthy practices
They keep and sell all the good parishables to local Businesses. And donate the goods that are about to expire. They leave a mess on the street and sidewalk everyday. Brings rodents, insects and pests.

originalText.text: Please respect your neighbors! Enough with the ear-splitting speaker on the sidewalk blasting at the time everyone puts their kids to bed. Be considerate! UPDATE 4/2020: From 1 star to 4. The ear-splitting speaker music on the sidewalk in the summer has not stopped but the church's foodbank feeds a ton of people in the neighborhood at least twice a week. That's something. Pictured is the free food given away on 7/17/2020.

originalText.text: Had to click one star cause you can’t put no stars! The paster is very rude and seems like it’s just a business. May god bless them and bless people who don’t do what’s right for their neighbors and church goers.

originalText.text: Puts their speakers outside to have service VERY LOUDLY, litter the whole area when they do their food bank, and I’ve heard also have shady business practices.
